title: DIGITAL COMPUTERS IN WHICH ALL THE COMPUTATION IS EFFECTED MECHANICALLY  (score computers for card games A63F1/18; construction of keys, printing mechanisms or other parts of general application to the typewriting or printing art B41; keys or printing mechanisms for special applications, see the relevant subclasses, e.g. G05G, G06K; cash registers G07G1/00)
Computing aids in which the computing members form at least part of the displayed result and are manipulated directly by hand, e.g. abacuses, pocket adding devices
informative_references: Arrangements for table look-up comprising also computing elements manipulated by handRosaries Indicating or scoring devices for games or playersAppliances for teaching counting or calculating Models for scientific, medical, or mathematical purposes

title: Arrangements for table look-up, e.g. menstruation table
informative_references: Ovulation period determination in humans Ovulation period determination in animals

title: Transfer mechanisms, e.g. for transmitting figures from the input mechanism into the computing mechanism  (G06C7/10, G06C11/00, G06C15/00 take precedence)
Output mechanism  (marking record carriers in general, visual presentation in general of results of the mathematical operations G06K)
informative_references: Marking record carriers in general, visual presentation in general of results of the mathematical operations

title: Storage mechanisms  (mechanical counters with input only to the lowest order G06M; information storage in general G11)
informative_references: Mechanical counters with input only to the lowest orderInformation storage in general

title: Computing mechanisms; Actuating devices therefor  (mechanisms for operating automatically upon more than two numbers otherwise than by repeated addition or substraction G06C21/00)

Programming mechanisms for determining steps to be performed by the computing machine, e.g. when a key or certain keys are depressed  (mechanisms merely for producing multiplication by repeated addition G06C15/08)
Driving mechanisms for functional elements  (G06C23/08 takes precedence over G06C23/02 - G06C23/06)
Auxiliary functional arrangements, e.g. interlocks  (interlocks in keyboards G06C7/04)
